res: What are the possible ranges (across all real inputs $x$ and $y$) of a polynomial $f(x, y)$ with real coefficients?Show that the possibles ranges are a single point, any half-open or half-closed semi-infinite interval, or all real numbers.

Translating: What are the possible ranges (across all real inputs $x$ and $y$) of a polynomial $f(x, y)$ with real coefficients?Show that the possibles ranges are a single point, any half-open or half-closed semi-infinite interval, or all real numbers.

roundTripFailures: What are the possible ranges (across all real inputs $x$ and $y$) of a polynomial $f(x, y)$ with real coefficients?Show that the possibles ranges are a single point, any half-open or half-closed semi-infinite interval, or all real numbers.

false
Theorem 1 is specific to polynomial functions, whereas Theorem 2 applies to all functions \( f: \mathbb{R} \times \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R} \).
